TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.TRANSL: “Come on, Ngangay, let’s collect some taro.

S.FORM: "ku alapaw anga i tja i navanavał."
"ko alapaw anga i tja i navanavalj."
S.TRANSL: “I’ll take him down when we get fyrther down south (? or to the right hand end).
“I’ll take him when we get to the end of the row.” (?)
I’m going to get some more taro.

S.FORM: ku patutuaw anga nusauni, nuka djemaqudjaqut aken."
ko patotoaw anga nosaoni, noka djemaqodjaqot aken."
S.TRANSL: I’ll suckle him later, while I cut the taro ends off.”

S.FORM: ku vutsilaw anan a tja kinsa a pasa qelutseqets."
ko vocilaw anan a tja kinsa a pasa qeloceqec."
S.TRANSL: I’ll set our food down on a tree.” (?)
She threw over some taro peel.
Ngangay crumbled it up and handed it over to him.

S.FORM: "pai vułuqi tu ita a ku kaka."
"pai voljoqi to ita a ko kaka."
ngitsu sakamaya sivułuq, sa łułu-i tu sikilunung ni Ngangay.
ngico sakamaya sivoljoq, sa ljoljo-i to sikilonong ni Ngangay.
S.TRANSL: It was just peel she threw over; and Ngangay picked it up and crumbled it up.
Her mother finished eating and got down (from the tree (OA)).

S.FORM: djemaqut anan aken tu ku kinatsu a sema umaq."
djemaqot anan aken to ko kinaco a sema omaq."
S.TRANSL: I’ll first take the taro home and cut the ends off.”

S.FORM: "pai tutu anga, kina; matsułangata ti Tjugeluy."
"pai toto anga, kina; macoljangata ti Tjogeloy."
S.TRANSL: “Do suckle him, mother; Tjugeluy is really hungry.”

S.FORM: ku palautaw anan tutsu a tsevatseva."
ko palaotaw anan toco a cevaceva."
S.TRANSL: I’ll just get them across this ravine.”

S.FORM: "ainu anga i kina?" aya ti Ngangay.
"aino anga i kina?" aya ti Ngangay.
S.TRANSL: “Where has mother got to?” said Ngangay.

S.FORM: nu patsun ta qutsivauvaw, "uzay anga ti kina a malap tjanuitjen."
no pacon ta qocivaovaw, "ozay anga ti kina a malap tjanoitjen."
S.TRANSL: When she saw a fire-fly, she thought: “Now mother has come to collect us.”

S.FORM: nu djemałun a qutsivauvaw, "ari kitjaula-u, Tjugeluy.
no djemaljon a qocivaovaw, "ari kitjaola-o, Tjogeloy.
S.TRANSL: When the fire-fly came, she said: “Come on, Tjugeluy, let’s stop this.
She tore the coverlet to make tails,
and split (?) the cape to make wings.

S.FORM: "ari, łevavavi ta kasiw, sa tja patsuni ti kama."
"ari, ljevavavi ta kasiw, sa tja paconi ti kama."
S.TRANSL: “Come on, let’s go up a tree and watch father.”

S.FORM: łakua qadjaw tuki anemanema sengsengan i djalan."
ljakoa qadjaw toki anemanema sengsengan i djalan."
S.TRANSL: But I don’t know what they are doing on the way.”

S.FORM: aku a ika ken a tsatsevutsevung?"
ako a ika ken a cacevocevong?"
S.TRANSL: Why don’t I meet up with them?”
But mother forced us into this

S.FORM: "siseqas ta vałvał, sa veseqitji ti Tjukutjuku.
"siseqas ta valjvalj, sa veseqitji ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: He cut a palm, and beat Tjuktjuku (She became a mouse (OA)).
There’s a hole in your storage box.”
friend, let’s fly away from here.
